intro: Altensteinia riobambae, commonly known as the Rio Bambá fern, is a rare and unique species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, frond-like structures that resemble bamboo leaves, hence its common name. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit with rhizomes that spread along the forest floor, forming dense mats. Its spore-producing structures, called sorus, are clustered on the underside of the fronds, typical of many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Altensteinia riobambae is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
